text:
Happy Friday, All! Here are today’s updates for the #case-tracking workstream:

The MoH has listed five forms that they need for reporting/tracking COVID-19. We don’t know yet if they will move forward with our recommended platforms so our aim is to be ready if and when they give us the green light. Forms 1-3 forms are in progress while 4-5 will begin tomorrow.

*Forms*
• *2A. POE & DOD Surveillance Pillar:* Port of Entry and for Door-to-Door (CommCare)
• *2B. Public Reporting Pillar:* Patient self-reporting/suspected case reporting (Ushahidi)
• *2C. Medical Center Reporting Pillar:* Medical centers reported cases (CommCare)
• *2D. Suspicious Cases Analysis Pillar:* Ensure we have Alerts from the call center reporting 
• *2E. Rapid Response Pillar*: getting alerts from the Case Analysts above 
*On-going work:*
• 2A, 2B, and 2C - <@U01076XHPC0>, <@U0105C870AC>, <@U0100B5MHDG> (respectively)
• <@U0109G64E31> is determining the export features for CommCare and Ushahidi for reporting dashboard
*Volunteers needed:*
1. One person to support on Ushahidi 
2. One person to own the case reporting dashboard (<https://co.vid19.sg/dashboard|example 1>, <http://covid.fynsystems.com/|example 2>)
Feel free to reach out to task owners directly if you’d like to support them. 

We will do a #case-tracking call after tomorrow morning’s all-hands meeting. Time is TBD. <!channel>

text:
Hey Everyone, some updates on Ushahidi.

• The deployment URL on Ushahidi is <https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/|https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/>


• If you want to test out the form, the link is <https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/posts/create/2|https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/posts/create/2>


• I started writing up the self reporting form, pretty much using Form A0 on Commcare as a template.


• <https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.ushahidi.com%2Fushahidi-platform-user-manual%2F|This is the link to the Ushahidi Platform User Manual>

elements.text: Hey Everyone, some updates on Ushahidi.
The deployment URL on Ushahidi is
https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/
If you want to test out the form, the link is
https://covid19et.ushahidi.io/posts/create/2
I started writing up the self reporting form, pretty much using Form A0 on Commcare as a template.
This is the link to the Ushahidi Platform User Manual

text:
Thanks for putting this together <@U0100B5MHDG>! :slightly_smiling_face:

Can we create a second form (or expand this one) for any health professional to report suspected cases they could not transfer to the Ministry of Health?
Check out <https://twitter.com/realBrookA/status/1239926765453180929|this twitter thread> from a health professional about a challenge they are facing.

I think being able to filter cases reported by health professionals might be helpful, as the government might decide to give it a higher-priority attention as the health professionals would presumably do a more thorough per-screening before reporting the case.

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/realBrookA|@realBrookA>: And it happened AGAIN!
Waiting for the past 4 hours for the #COVID19 "task force" to take a suspected person fulfilling the case definition.
This time around I cannot send the patient home because she needs oxygen supplementation.
Absolutely outrageous! <https://twitter.com/realBrookA/status/1239637869658017800>
attachments.text:
And it happened AGAIN!
Waiting for the past 4 hours for the #COVID19 "task force" to take a suspected person fulfilling the case definition.
This time around I cannot send the patient home because she needs oxygen supplementation.
Absolutely outrageous! <https://twitter.com/realBrookA/status/1239637869658017800>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/realBrookA|@realBrookA>: So this happened
This morning at the clinic, I saw a guy whom I suspected to have #COVID19. He had mild symptoms and looks generally ok. I had him put on a facemask and kept him at the isolation room. I had our focal person call the <https://twitter.com/FMoHealth|@FMoHealth> #COVID19 "task force". (1)

text: <@UV7TX2KR9> That’s definitely possible. Would the questions be different? I feel like it would be similar to self reporting, so we can just ask(like the Commcare form) if they would like to report someone else they know.

text: I think additional questions that would would make verification easier later would be helpful (in addition to their contacts, things like name of their institution, medical license number - if such a thing exists might make verification easier and reduce abuse of the platform)

text:
Hi <@UV7TX2KR9>
I like the idea of:
1. Adding a question to the form in Ushahidi to say if you are reporting a case on behalf of someone else (This would be only for self-reporting on Ushahidi) because CommCare forms are intended to be filled by health care professionals
2. Being able to filter through cases reported by professionals
re: login credentials we are awaiting for direction from MoH but  the form requires self-identification for the person filling out the form so unique log-in credentials may be redundant

elements.text: Hi
I like the idea of:

Adding a question to the form in Ushahidi to say if you are reporting a case on behalf of someone else (This would be only for self-reporting on Ushahidi) because CommCare forms are intended to be filled by health care professionals
Being able to filter through cases reported by professionals
re: login credentials we are awaiting for direction from MoH but  the form requires self-identification for the person filling out the form so unique log-in credentials may be redundant

text: Its important that Medical professionals will *only* use the CommCare form. It functionality to allow for checking back in with patients and tracking the people infected people have been in contact with. Forms should used only for their intended group/purpose so that we don't risk reporting incorrect informaton to MoH
